explanation: The original final line treated the case of exactly two fixed positions incorrectly (checking count != 2). For permutations of three distinct hats, the unreachable case after an even number of swaps (10^18) is when exactly one position matches (a single transposition, odd permutation). I fixed the condition to check count != 1, so we print "Yes" for 0 or 3 matches (even permutations) and "No" for 1 match (odd permutation).
fixed_code:
S=list(input().split())
T=list(input().split())
count=0
for i in range(3):
  if S[i]==T[i]:
    count+=1
print("Yes") if count!=1 else print("No")
